contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Mie'''|三重町|Mie-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Ōno District, Ōita|Ōno District]], [[Ōita Prefecture|Ōita]], [[Japan]]. On March 31, 2005 Mie was merged with the towns of [[Asaji, Ōita|Asaji]], [[Inukai, Ōita|Inukai]], [[Ogata, Ōita|Ogata]] and [[Ōno, Ōita|Ōno]], and the villages of [[Chitose, Ōita|Chitose]] and [[Kiyokawa, Ōita|Kiyokawa]], all from [[Ōno District, Ōita|Ōno District]], to form the new city of [[Bungo-ōno, Ōita|Bungo-Ōno]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 18,241 and the [[population density|density]] of 112.48 persons per km². The total area was 162.17 km². {{DEFAULTSORT:Mie, Oita}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ōita Prefecture]] {{Oita-geo-stub}}
